intro: Gnaphaliothamnus nesomii, commonly known as Nesom's goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils and open habitats. It produces small, yellow to golden flower heads that bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are usually narrow, linear, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant adaptations.
